fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the 'Any logged in user' permission is added to 'Browse Project' permission in a Service Desk project, customer will automatically receive notifications when mentioned in an internal comment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk project.
 # Head to project settings > Permission Scheme.
 # Add the 'Application Access' > 'Any logged in user' permission in the 'Browse Project' permission.
 # Head to an issue, then, mention a customer in the ticket.

h3. Expected Results

Customer will not be receiving any notifications when an internal comment is added.
h3. Actual Results

Customer receives notification when an internal comment is added.
h3. Workaround

Remove the 'Any logged in user' permission in the 'Browse Project' permission of project,
fields.summary: When the 'Any logged in user' permission is added to 'Browse Project' permission in a Service Desk project, customer will automatically receive notifications when mentioned in an internal comment.

h3. Issue Summary
In a case where a user has a really long Display Name, it will get wrapped in the Customer Portal "Shared with" section including the Avatar. Compare to Agent View/JIRA Issue Detail View where it will not be wrapped.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new User with a long Display Name.
# Add the user a Service Desk Project Customer.
# Add the user as a Participant of a Ticket.
# View the ticket from the Customer Portal view

h3. Expected Results
- Like in the JIRA Issue Details view, the name would not be wrapped or at least below the Avatar.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
- Else, to be shown like in the User Management Page
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Result
- The Display Name will be wrapped.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
(i) Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Display Name is wrapped in the Customer Portal if it is too long

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Permalink To Comment URL Is Not Working In Service Desk Project 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new JIRA Service Desk Project and create a new issue
# Open the new issue and add a new comment into it
# Click on the comment permalink as shown in below screenshot
 !image-2018-09-19-21-39-08-769.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2018-09-19-21-39-43-966.png|thumbnail! 
# It will direct us to a blank page due to the wrong URL.

h3. Expected Results
We should be redirected to the comment on the same issue.

h3. Actual Results
The link generated is wrong and a blank page is shown.

h3. Notes
* The issue only impacting JIRA Service Desk project. JIRA Core or JIRA Software is working perfectly.
* By looking at the URL we see that for our example we get:{code}
http://localhost:8080/browse/SD-2?focusedCommentId=10019&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel\#comment-10019
{code}
While the correct accessible URL shall be as below. We are required to remove the '\' in "tabpanel\#comment-10019".
{code}
http://localhost:8080/browse/SD-2?focusedCommentId=10019&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-10019
{code}

h3.*Workaround*
Manually remove the '\' from the URL.
fields.summary: Permalink To Comment URL Is Not Working In Service Desk Project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

For Jira Service Desk Desk, customer does not count against licenses and a Service Desk instance can have theoretically unlimited customers. The organization just have to pay for the license based on Agent number.

If Jira Service Desk is connected to Crowd SSO and all agents and customers are located at Crowd SSO, the organization will have to purchase Crowd license to accommodate all their agents and customers. This was not clearly documented in the documentation below:

* [Notes on using Atlassian Crowd to manage customers |https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-managing-customers-in-jira-service-desk#JIRAServiceDesk:ManagingcustomersinJIRAServiceDesk-NotesonusingAtlassianCrowdtomanagecustomers]


h3. Suggested Solution

Update the [Notes on using Atlassian Crowd to manage customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-managing-customers-in-jira-service-desk#JIRAServiceDesk:ManagingcustomersinJIRAServiceDesk-NotesonusingAtlassianCrowdtomanagecustomers] documentation to explain the behavior with using Jira Service Desk connected to Crowd SSO and customers are in Crowd SSO.
fields.summary: Documentation for Service Desk users from Crowd

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Queue Count Search is being performed to all Queues throughout the Project, regardless of which Queue is currently worked on. This leads to noticeable loading time when Queues are using complex JQL.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the Queue Count Search only performed on the current Queue rather than the whole Queues in the project. Perhaps the Queue Count Search for the entire project can only be performed after a set interval or certain specific actions.

h3. Workaround 
It is possible to disable the Queue Count Search on Project Level or Globally via REST API. However, this will disable the Queue Counter.
(i) It is suggested to test out the REST API on a testing instance first.
*Global (Entire JIRA instance):*
{code}
PUT <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/include-count - true/false body - 200 response (default true)
{code}

*Per project:*
{code}
PUT <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/<projectkey>/include-count - true/false body - 200 response (default true)
{code}
fields.summary: Make Queue Count Search individually based on the current queue

fields.description:
*Issue Description*

When looking at a Service Desk report about breached SLA, the number of issues for the most recent period (day, week, month) always has the value "0", regardless of how many issues belong to this period.

*Steps to Reproduce*

- Create a new Service Desk project
- Create a few issues in this project
- Wait for the "Time to Resolution" SLA to breach for these issues, or simply edit the goal for this SLA to 1 minute, so that these issues can breach quickly
- Go to the project report page
- Create a new report with the series "Time to Resolution (Breached)"
- Look at the number of issues listed for each date, and noticed that for the most recent day, it is showing "0":
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
- Click on the "0" link next to the most recent day, and notice that all the breached issues are returned there, even though there was "0" result shown on the previous page:
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 

*Observed*

The number of issues that belong to the most recent period is shown as "0".

*Expected*

This number should match the actual number of issues that we see when clicking on the "0" link
fields.summary: Service Desk SLA reports incorrectly show the value 0 for the number of issues that belong to the most recent period

As a service desk project lead, I want to be able to import Customer Satisfaction responses from CSV.

fields.description:
=============
*Reason for the closure of this bug ticket:*

We identified that the bug was on the Confluence side, and is tracked in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-58392, so please follow this bug ticket instead.
=============

*Issue Description*

When Service Desk is integrated with Confluence 6.15.4, the following issue happens: when a customer clicks on a KB article from the Service Desk Customer Portal, they get the following error:
{code}The knowledge base article could not be found
{code}
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 

Note that when the Customer clicks on the same KB article from the issue creation form, the page loads properly:
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 

*Steps to Reproduce*

- Install any Service Desk version such as 3.15.x, 3.16.x, 4.1.0
- Install Confluence 6.15.4
- Create an application link between Confluence and Service Desk using Oauth with impersonation
- Configure an external user directory in Confluence using the JIRA directory to ensure that the JIRA users exist in Confluence
- Create a space in Confluence
- Create an article in this space (with "laptop" as a title)
- Create a new Service Desk project, and configure the Knowledge Base setting as follows:
-- Use the space created in Confluence
-- Select the option "All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license"
- Log into the Service Desk customer portal with a user *which does not have a Confluence license*
- Search for the KB article by typing "laptop" in the search box
- Click on the KB article

*Observed*

- The KB article loads forever (we get a spinning wheel)
- If we refresh the page, we get the following error in the UI:
{code}The knowledge base article could not be found
{code}
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
- If we collect a HAR file, we get a a 404 error with the request "/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/models"
- The following error is thrown in the logs:
{code}
2019-06-06 14:48:54,958 http-nio-8080-exec-7 ERROR customer1 888x235x1 oqwnl5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/kb/view/884742 [c.a.s.i.api.applink.BaseAppLinkResponseHandler] Applink request has returned an error %s
2019-06-06 14:48:54,958 http-nio-8080-exec-7 ERROR customer1 888x235x1 oqwnl5 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /servicedesk/customer/kb/view/884742 [c.a.s.i.api.applink.BaseAppLinkResponseHandler] Confluence could not find the requested page and returned a 404
{code}

*Additional notes*

- The issue occurs whether the Confluence application is configured with anonymous access or not
- The issue *does not happen* in the 2 following scenarios:
-- The user has a Confluence license: in this case, this user can open the KB article from *both the Customer Portal homepage, and from the request creation form*
-- The user does not have a Confluence license and *opens the KB article from the request creation form*
fields.summary: When Service Desk is integrated with Confluence 6.15.4, knowledge base articles can't be open from the Customer Portal (error 404)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The 'field help' is essentially a description of a field in Customer Portal. In newer versions, the 'field help' is displayed below the field instead of beside the field.

This is triggered in the new portal experience introduced in [Jira Service Desk 4.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/a-stylish-new-portal-for-jira-service-desk-server-and-data-center-customers-963663645.html] whereby enabling the new layout in Customer Portal reduces the form container width. 

h3. Steps to replicate
# Note the 'field help' position in the Customer Portal - [^JSD-description_at_the_side.png]
# Enable the new layout
# Note the 'field help' position in the Customer Portal - [^JSD-description_at_the_bottom.png]


h3. Suggested Solution
Display 'field help' at the side of the field 
 
h3. Workaround 
Disabling the new portal experience will return the field help to the side of the field. However, disabling this dark feature will also disable all the new features such banner image.
# Navigate to the dark feature page at <Jira_URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa 
(i) Refer to this guide: [Enable Dark Feature in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html]
# Look for the *sd.customerportal.customization.enabled* under the 'Site Wide Dark Features' section
# Disable the dark feature

h3. Note
*The new portal experience is enabled by default beginning Jira Service Desk 4.6. The dark feature will not be effective from this version onward.*
fields.summary: Display Field Help at the side of the fields in Customer Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Description*
Currently, referring to [How teams see SLAs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/how-teams-see-slas-946617611.html], it is not stated what the section in "within 1d" is referring to ( [^image-2019-05-31-17-27-12-615.png] ). It can be confusing as this section is actually referring to the time between SLA start date and expected end date, taking into account pauses in between.

Eg: SLA is configured to 120 hours and calendar shows a 40 hours work week. Logically, this section would show ~ 3w. However, should the issue be paused for an extended period of time, say, 1 month, then this section shows "1mo".

*Suggestion*
Describe this clearly in the documentation to reduce confusion.
fields.summary: Clarify information seen on SLA tab

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Description*
Currently, as per [How teams see SLAs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/how-teams-see-slas-946617611.html], under the Units of Time section, it is stated that only 1 or 2 units at a time are displayed. For months and years, only one would be displayed.

*Suggestion*
It would be better if 2 units can be displayed for months and years. Eg: {{1mo 2w}} instead of {{1mo}} only. This would provide a more accurate time calculation.
fields.summary: Increase information seen on SLA tab for more accurate timing

fields.description:
*Description*
At the moment, the SLA's goals (configured in Project Settings -> SLA) is not seen on Jira issue view unless multiple cycles of the SLA has happened. If multiple cycles have happened, then the user can hover over the (/) or (x) mark and see the SLA goal for that cycle as seen in [^screenshot-1.png].

While the "within Xd Xh" section [^screenshot-2.png] might show the configured SLA's goals, it can be inaccurate if there are significant pauses in the SLA.

*Suggestion*
Have a mechanism to show the SLA goal on Jira Issue View.
fields.summary: Show SLA's goals on Jira Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It appears that the Knowledge Base link to the Confluence space will not be updated even though it has been changed in the Application Link. This affects the suggestions shown from the "Summary" field to use the old URL.

h3, Steps to Replicate.
# Link an SD Project to a Knowledge-Based.
# Change the Application Link URL of Confluence to any working URL such as Confluence IP.
(i) The test was done to a Confluence that can be accessed through HTTP and HTTPS. The change made was from HTTPS to HTTP
# Save the configuration.
# Raise a request.
# In the summary, type a string that is similar to one of a page in the linked Confluence Space.
# MouseOver on the suggestions.

h3. Expected Result
The link will be updated with the new URL for Confluence

h3. Actual Result
The link will still be using the Old URL

h3. Notes
- The value of the Applink URL and Space URL appears to not change as the Application Link URL is changed.
{noformat}
test810=# select * from "AO_54307E_CONFLUENCEKB";
       APPLINKS_APPLICATION_ID        | APPLINK_NAME |            APPLINK_URL            | ID | SERVICE_DESK_ID | SPACE_KEY | SPACE_NAME |                   SPACE_URL                   
--------------------------------------+--------------+-----------------------------------+----+-----------------+-----------+------------+-----------------------------------------------
 4ab6f8bc-3ddc-3034-9b6e-1576ae9bcf57 | Confluence   | https://localhost:8443/confluence |  2 |               1 | SAP       | Sap        | https://localhost:8443/confluence/display/SAP
(1 row)
{noformat} 

h3. Workaround
Re-link the Project Knowledge Base to have the URL updated.
fields.summary: Knowledge Base Link is not update as Application Link URL is changed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user is both the Reporter and Request Participant but do not have *Modify Reporter* permission granted, the user will not able to make any transitions in the Customer Portal.

*Steps to replicate:*
# Assign a user as the Reporter and Request Participant of a request
# Revoke the *Modify Reporter* permission from the user
# As the user, try to make any transition from the Customer Portal
# Notice that even after clicking the transition button, everything will still remain the same
# Despite the lack of error log entries in the log files, the HAR file will throw an error Response 400:
{code}
errors: [{errorMessage: "You do not have permission to modify the issue reporter.", field: "reporter"}]
reasonCode: "400"
reasonKey: "transition failed validation"
{code}

*Note:* This bug is not to be confused with the one reported in [JSDSERVER-5162|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5162]. Although looks rather similar, this bug only occurs if the affected user was not granted the *Modify Reporter* permission.

h3. Expected Results
Able to transition the request from Customer Portal as there are not Conditions/Validators.

h3. Actual Results
Not able to transition the request from Customer Portal despite the transition not having any Conditions/Validators.

h3.Workaround
* Grant the affected user the *Modify Reporter* permission
* Change the Reporter to a different user
fields.summary: Not able to transition in Customer Portal when user is both the Reporter and Request Participant but do not have Modify Reporter permission

When trying to export SLA values to Excel after disabling the Dark feature {{sd.sla.improved.rendering.enabled}} to revert the SLA rendering format (as explained on [How To Revert The SLA Rendering Improvement Changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-revert-the-sla-rendering-improvement-changes-943970007.html]), Microsoft Excel displays #VALUE! for negative SLA values. The values are correctly displayed as expected.

Negative SLA values are displayed as #VALUE!

h3. Summary
When moving a Service Desk Request to another issue type, the Request Type will change to "No Match" if none is selected when moving. # Create an Issue/Ticket
# Move the ticket to change the Issue Type
# Set the Customer Request Type to "No Match" and confirm the moving.
# Search for the issue in the Issue Navigator

h3. Expected Result
The Request Type will be removed and shown as "No Match"

h3. Actual Result
The old request type value is retained.

h3. Notes
- Re-indexing does not helo
- Different versions show different behavior:
-# Jira Service Desk 3.12: in the issue list "No match" is shown
-# Jira Service Desk 3.15: in the issue list the old customer request type is shown
-# Jira Service Desk 4.1: in the issue list the old customer request type is shown

h3. Workaround
- None to be found yet

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using a _relative_ URL for "link.login.url" in {{seraph-config.xml}} results in a HTTP 303 redirect to a location to a URL that incorrectly contains the Service Desk _request context_ in the middle, resulting in a request for a non-existing URL.

If parameter "link.login.url" in {{seraph-config.xml}} contains an _absolute_ URL the redirection works as expected.

This is broken. Jira should always work with relative URLs. 

h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk with SSO

h3. Steps to Reproduce
URLs in example:
*Jira BaseUrl*: "https://test-jira.example.com/tracker-test/
*JSD portal URL*: "https://test-jira.example.com/tracker-test/servicedesk/customer/portal/1"

* Set "link.login.url" in {{seraph-config.xml}} to a _relative_ URL, such as "/test-login.jsp?pemissionViolation=true&redirectTo=${originalurl}"
* Go to https://test-jira.example.com/tracker-test without an active session
* Jira redirects to a non-existent URL

h3. Expected Results
Jira responds with a HTTP 303 with Location https://test-jira.example.com/tracker-test/test-login.jsp?redirectTo=%2Fservicedesk%2Fcustomer%2Fportal%2F1*

h3. Actual Results
Jira responds with a HTTP 303 with Location https://test-jira.example.com/tracker-test/rest/servicedesk/1/tracker-test/test-login.jsp?redirectTo=%2Fservicedesk%2Fcustomer%2Fportal%2F1*

*/rest/servicedesk/1/tracker-test* should not be there.

h3. Notes
It has been identified that this happens becuase *Response.seeOther* is used to build the final URL. From [JavaDoc for Response.seeOther|https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/api/javax/ws/rs/core/Response.html#seeOther-java.net.URI-]

{quote}
If a relative URI is supplied it will be converted into an absolute URI by resolving it relative to the base URI of the application (see UriInfo.getBaseUri()).
{quote}

JSD has a wrapped version of *UriInfo* which is based on the _request context_, which in this case will have {{/rest/servicedesk/1/tracker-test}} in the path. As JSD is installed and handling this request, the *BaseUri* which *Response.seeOther* uses to make the redirect an absolute path now has {{/rest/servicedesk/1/tracker-test}} in it.

When "link.login.url" in {{seraph-config.xml}} is set to a _absolute_ URL, such as "https://test-jira-example.com/tracker-test/test-login.jsp?pemissionViolation=true&redirectTo=${originalurl}", we do not run into this bug as *Response.seeOther* then does not use *baseUri* to modify the URL.

h3. Workaround
Use absolute URL for "link.login.url" in {{seraph-config.xml}} if possible.
fields.summary: Using a relative URL in "link.login.url" in seraph-config.xml results in an incorrect redirection URL

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JSD 4.1 logs are flooded with SdOffThreadEventJobRunner INFO messages

As a result, built in JIRA log analyzer falsely detects that JIRA is affected by this issue:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5736
 In one customer's environment the message count is over 18K+
h3. How to Replicate
 # Deploy brand new JSD 4.1 and create a test JSD project with sample data
 # In that project add a couple more automation rules (might be optional)
 # Perform a few activities on JIRA tickets (like add a comment, change the assignee etc) while monitoring (tail -f) atlassian-jira.log - see how SdOffThreadEventJobRunner logs the following messages:

{panel}
2019-05-20 11:19:42,657 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-2 INFO sergeos 679x128x1 stz5eq 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue/10037/comment [c.a.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter] [lucene-stats] flush stats: snapshotCount=5, totalCount=5, periodSec=0, flushIntervalMillis=41, indexDirectory=null, indexWriterId=com.atlassian.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter@6bc25ef1, indexDirectoryId=RAMDirectory@95c9a34 lockFactory=org.apache.lucene.store.SingleInstanceLockFactory@db81932
{panel}
h3. Workaround

Add "com.atlassian.jira.index.MonitoringIndexWriter" custom package to logging and profiling in JIRA and set the debug log level to ERROR. 
 That is until JIRA is restarted. To get the setting permanent, it'll need to be added to log4.properties file as per this article:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/logging-and-profiling-861253813.html]
fields.summary: JIRA log is flooded with SdOffThreadEventJobRunner MonitoringIndexWriter INFO messages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Agents/admins don't have the option to be notified when a customer completes a satisfaction survey

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add a notification event in the notification scheme for survey completed

h3. Why this is important
* Allows admins to be more proactive in addressing/reviewing survey results
 
h3. Workaround
* Create a custom script/app that uses the {{jira:issue_updated}} [webhook|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/webhooks/] event to listen for changes to the "Satisfaction" field and to trigger an alert via your mail provider - or similar workaround
* Use the third-party app [Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview](or similar app) to create a rule that listens for changes to the "Satisfaction" field and then if the conditions are met - send an email to predefined recipients.  Similar to what is shown here:
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-17 at 10.47.53.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer Satisfaction(cSAT): Send notification to admins/agents when a customer completes a survey

h3. Problem definition
Due to [deprecation of 2LOi application link on Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/end-of-support-for-2loi-application-links-950806698.html], Jira Service Desk on server cannot utilize knowledge base found on Confluence Cloud instance (which can be also concluded from here: [Update: Knowledge bases must be on the same domain as your service desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2018/10/update-knowledge-bases-must-be-on-the-same-domain-as-your-service-desk]).
Modifying application link to use "OAuth" (withoug impersonation) makes knowledge articles non-searchable, which means this functionality does not work anymore.

h3. Suggested resolution
Develop a mean of integration that would enable Service Desk server users to use Confluence Cloud knowledge base again.

h3. Notes
The functionality does work if "OAuth" is being used in the link configuration and if Confluence Cloud is configured to be used with Anonymous access.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The behavior of the *Due Date: Not Passed* condition when it is used as a *Paused* condition in an SLA configuration is inconsistent when an issue has an empty due date:
- if the issue is created after the SLA is created, then the SLA will be paused
- if the issue is created before the SLA is created, then the SLA will be running

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In a Service Desk project, create an SLA configured to pause with the *Due Date: Not Passed* condition. Let's call this SLA "Due Date SLA"
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new issue with an empty due date, and observe that the SLA "Due Date SLA" *is paused*
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an SLA configured to pause with the *Due Date: Not Passed* condition. Let's call this SLA "Due Date SLA 2"
 !Step3.png|thumbnail! 
# Refresh the issue created previously and observe that the SLA "Due Date SLA 2" *is running*
 !Step4.png|thumbnail! 
# Run the API call from the KB article [Missing/Corrupted SLA data in Jira Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-sla-data-in-jira-servicedesk-828790603.html] to reconstruct all the SLAs with this issue:
{code}
Method: POST
URL:<baseUrl>/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sla/admin/task/destructive/reconstruct?force=false
Body: ["ISSUEKEY-XXX"]
{code}
# Refresh the issue, and observe that now the SLA "Due Date SLA" *is running*
 !Step6.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The behavior of an SLA pausing on the *Due Date: Not Passed* condition should be consistent when the due date is empty, regardless if:
- the issue was created before or after the SLA was created
- the SLA recalculation API call was sent or not

h3. Actual Results

The behavior of an SLA pausing on the *Due Date: Not Passed* condition is not consistent when the due date is empty.

h3. Workaround

Since the behavior of the *Due Date: Not Passed* condition is inconsistent when the due date is empty, but is working properly when the due date is set, a workaround would be to set the due date as a mandatory field to prevent it from being ever empty.

h3. Suggested solution for the bug fix

In addition to making the behavior of the *Due Date: Not Passed* condition (regardless if an issue was created before or after the creation of an SLA configuration), it would be great if we could make this behavior configurable, so that based on its configuration, the SLA is:
- either running when the Due Date field is empty
- or pausing when the Due Date field is empty
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior of the "Due Date: Not Passed" SLA condition when the due date field is empty

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary
When a Service Desk request gets approved, the "Past approvals" section appears on the right hand side:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

"Past approval" does not seem to be translated in any language (I tested the German and Dutch languages so far).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a Service Desk request that has an approval step
- Approve the Service Desk request
- As an Agent, Change the language on profile page to German (or some other language)
- Open this request from Agent's view

h3. Expected results
The section subject should be translated (e.g. in German: "Vergangene Genehmigungen")

h3. Actual results
The section subject is still in English ("Past approvals")

h3. Workaround
(i) Tested in JSD 4.1.0
# Navigate to the link below to download the compatible OBR file for the current your JIRA version
-- [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213632/jira-service-desk/version-history]
 # After downloaded, change the {{.obr}} filetype to {{.zip}} so it can be extracted.
 # Inside it, there will be another JAR file called _"jira-servicedesk-application-x.x.x.jar"_
 # Change the filetype from JAR to ZIP as well to make it extractable, then extract the files from the ZIP archive
 # Find the necessary translation file in which in this case it is _jira-servicedesk-application-4.1.0_ > i18n > sd-approvals-i18n_de_DE.properties
 # Add the following string to the last of the line:
{code:java}
sd.approval.panel.past.label=Vergangene Genehmigungen{code}
(i) Feel free to change the translated text if needed.
 # Save the file.
 # Using the terminal, navigate to the _"jira-servicedesk-application-4.1.0"_ directory
{code:java}cd <path to dir>/jira-servicedesk-application-4.1.0{code}
 # From inside the directory, run the following command:
{code:java}jar cf ../jira-servicedesk-application-4.1.0.jar * {code}
 # The JAR file will be created and then upload it through the _JIRA Administration > Manage apps > Manage apps_
# The translation is now active and it corrected:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

For any existing users that already have German as its language set in the profile, the change might not immediate. Try creating a new user and change the user language to see the effect. Also, try accessing the ticket using another browser or in incognito mode for the testing.
fields.summary: Missing Service Desk translation for "Past approvals" section subject

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Service Desk Automation rule doesn't get triggered when certain emails containing attachments are received via Jira Core handler

h3. Environment
* Jira Core handler being used as channel to receive emails from Jira licensed user (who act as "collaborators" on a Service Desk project)
* Service Desk Automation rule gets triggered on a new comment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Service Desk automation rule to get triggered by "Comment added" step
# Set up Jira Core handler as an incoming mail channel that licensed Jira users will use in role of "collaborator"
# Collaborator sends an email that contains attachments (or image in signature) to Jira Core handler address
# The mail gets processed and an internal comment gets added to the ticket

h3. Expected Results
The Automation rule gets triggered based on the added comment.

h3. Actual Results
The Automation rule doesn't get triggered at all.

h3. Notes
The issue is caused by the attachments. The explanation for this is: the way JSD/Automation handle the events won't treat an e-mail comment with attachments as just a comment added, but as an issue event (the attachment is and update on the issue) and a comment added during an update.
In the end, the Issue Event listener will expect that the Comment Added listener would handle the event, and the Comment added listener expects that the Issue Event listener will do that. The result of this is that the rule is not getting triggered.

h3. Workaround
* Avoid sending email with attachments (including the images in signature area)
* Use Service Desk mail handler as an incoming channel for collaborator users
fields.summary: Service Desk Automation rule doesn't get triggered when certain emails containing attachments are received via Jira Core handler

+Suggested behavior:+ 

*When a JIRA Administrator looks at the project "Email Request" page, show something that makes them aware that the following exist.* 
 * *Mail handler logs*
 ** A link to logs that is easily visible would be good.
 * *Global email requests configuration options*
 ** So the admin knows the options exist and can review them
 ** A nice improvement would be to have some summary of these options shown on the project email requests page

The logs and global email request options are only available to users who are JIRA Administrators. This is the reason for only showing this info to those users.

+Existing Behavior:+ 

 There are two pages titled "Email Requests"
 * Each JSD project has an "Email Requests" page - This is where the incoming email account is configured
 * There is also an "Email Requests" page in the Applications section of JIRA Administration - This is where global settings are configured. This also has a list of mail handlers and links to logs.
 ** Note that JSD has a third email administration page. The "Global Mail Settings" in the System section of JIRA Administration is where the email services can be disabled/enabled.

Project (4.1.0):
 !projectEmailRequests.png|thumbnail!

Admin (4.1.0):
 !globalEmailRequests.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Currently, Jira Service Desk registers all email notifications sent in the database, but there is no way to view this from the UI.

Additionally, due to the dynamic of Agents and Customers, it can be complex to recreate scenarios and understand when/why a notification is sent to a user considering him a Customer instead of as an Agent or viceversa.

From this, from an administrator's perspective, it would be beneficial to have a functionality where you can see all emails sent from Service Desk, project-based, and with filters that allow flexibility like: Date, Issuekey, Event triggered, Recipient, Content (if it is a comment it could have a link to said comment), Type of notification (Customer or Jira).
fields.summary: Improve the traceability of emails sent

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, when having to troubleshoot behavior that can possibly be caused by automation, it is necessary to go look one by one to know what each of the automation does, which can turn really cumbersome once the number of automation grows. Having several administrators or admin rotation will also make this task additionally complex.

*The suggestion is* to add a functionality that allows searching or filtering automation that includes certain IF/WHEN/THEN clause combination, so it is easier to find which automation could be triggering specific behavior.

For example: if we have a certain comment added that we suspect is added by an automation and we have 100 automation. We can go to the suggested functionality and filter for all automation that have a THEN clause for "Comment added", narrowing down the number of automations to check in a couple of clicks instead of going through each of them.
fields.summary: Add an Automation Helper

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When configuring Service Desk Customer Notification templates, it is possible to include the full details of a request based on the fields configured in the Request Types settings, per the documentation [Include issue variables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/managing-service-desk-notifications-939926348.html#Managingservicedesknotifications-Includemoreinformationusingtemplatevariables].

To do this, we need to include the variable ${request.details} in the template, like it's the case for the default Approval notification template.

The problem is that only JIRA's native fields are supported, and some fields coming from 3rd party add-ons might not be included in the notifications (like it's the case for "Insight Objects" type fields), even if such fields are added to the Request Type configuration.

Our documentation does not clearly specify that fields coming from 3rd party-add ons are not supported in the customer notification template. All we mention is the following:
{quote}
The full details of a request.
This includes the creation date, request type, summary, and the same fields chosen in the request type settings.
{quote}

Because of this, customers might mistakenly assume that any type of field coming from 3rd part add-on can be added to these templates.

h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the documentation around the variable ${request.details} to explain that it might not be able to include non native fields (3rd party add-on fields), since we do not support them
fields.summary: Mention in the customer notification documentation that 3rd party add-on fields are not supported  by the variable ${request.details}

To do this, we need to include the variable ${request.details} in the template, like it's the case for the default Approval notification template.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There are some issue statuses: (Waiting for support) & (Waiting for customer) that auto-generated by Jira Service Desk are categorized with a "No Category". The "No Category" is not allowed in normal Jira usage where all statues are required to be categorized into: 

* To Do
* In Progress
* Done

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira Service Desk.
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Check the workflow(for Service or Service Request type).

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk creates the workflow with all the status in a valid category, "To Do", "In Progress" or "Done".

h3. Actual Results
Service Desk creates two status, "Waiting for support" and "Waiting for customer" without a category, they are set to "No Category" with the grey color.

h3. Notes
Normally when you create a status you cannot choose "No Category".
Having a status with no category can affect the Kanban board with the "Hide Completed issues" feature. Issues on a status without a category will be removed from the board as well as done issues.


h3. Workaround
You can change the category of the status after it has been created.
fields.summary: Service Desk workflow creates status without category

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Desk timezone and the mail server timezone are different.

Jira for example is GMT and the mail server is GMT-7. When Service Desk mail reads the mail for today it doesn't find any since today has not happened yet in UTC (1 day behind).
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 *
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Jira timezone to GMT+10
 # Set mail server timezone to GMT-10
 # Send an email to the mail server (before 8pm GMT-10)

h3. Expected Results

Mail is processed as it arrived and unread.
h3. Actual Results

Due to filter by date nothing is picked up since it's 1 day behind.
h3. Workaround

Set the Jira and mail server to use the same timezone.
fields.summary: When Jira Service Desk and the mail server are on different timezones mail will not be read on time.

fields.description:
*Suggestion*
At the moment, if an email fails to trigger a comment or an issue in Jira, there are no notifications to anyone regarding this failure. This causes the problem where nobody realizes that a particular email fails to get processed, until after some time is passed or if an admin happens to review the Processing Logs.

It would be great if a notification to either a Jira admin or the user is triggered when email fails to process.

fields.description:
When opening an issue on behalf of a customer, the Customer Portal displays the customer account as the creator, however, logged as an agent, searching the issue using a JQL will show up the agent in the "*Creator*" field.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a ticket as behalf of a customer. 
!step-1.png|thumbnail!
2. In the Customer Portal, you will see information with the "Creator" field.
!step-2.png|thumbnail!
3. As an agent, we can check that the "*Creator*" field is different than what is being displayed in the Portal.
!step-3.png|thumbnail!

This might bring inconsistent data information, since the same field has different values, and companies that are audited can have issues with this inconsistent data;

h4. Suggestion:
Rename the portal "*Creator*" field to "*Reporter*" as it seems more accurate as agent view.

h3. Summary

The banner image from the customer portal is not loaded when logging into the portal as a customer user without a license.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install Service Desk 4.1.0 where the [new Customer Portal|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/a-stylish-new-portal-for-jira-service-desk-server-and-data-center-customers-963663645.html#AstylishnewportalforJiraServiceDeskServerandDataCentercustomers-banner] was implemented per the [JSD 4.1.0 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-4-1-x-release-notes-963663641.html]
# Create a new Service Desk project
# Enable the new customer portal for this project, per [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/a-stylish-new-portal-for-jira-service-desk-server-and-data-center-customers-963663645.html]
# Add a banner image to the portal, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !Step1.png|thumbnail! 
# Log into the customer portal as a customer type user (user who does not have any JIRA license and who has access to the portal according to the Project's customer permission settings)

The customer should be able to see the banner image on the customer portal, as it's the case for any user who has a JIRA license:
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

When using the Chrome Developer tool, we can see that the following request returns a 302 error:
<JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/servicedesk/1/bannerImage?1556549220681

No known workaround for now.

h3. Issue Summary
If Modify Reporter permission is revoked from Service Desk Customer - Portal Access, then customers with mixed-case username can't edit request participants from Customer Portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an SD project's permission scheme and revoke Modify Reporter permission from Service Desk Customer - Portal Access
# Create a customer account with mixed-case username e.g. Adam
# Raise a request on behalf of Adam in the above project and add a participant to it
# Log in as Adam via Customer Portal
# Try to add a new participant to or remove the existing one from the above request

h3. Expected Results
Participants can be added or removed normally.

h3. Actual Results
* 500 error is thrown for adding participants (sharing)
* 400 error is thrown for removing participants (unsharing)

h3. Workaround
Grant Modify Reporter permission to Service Desk Customer - Portal Access. This doesn't allow customers to modify reporters, so shouldn't be a problem at all.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
# JSDSERVER-3232 has been fixed on JSD version 3.1.2.
# On JSD 4 and above, we are seeing similar log messages in the log file:
{noformat}
2019-04-04 03:53:06,880 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-3681 ERROR abc@abc.com xxx /rest/api/2/issue/ABC-100/transitions [c.a.s.p.a.modules.rulewhen.ServiceDeskCommentCreatedEventWhenHandler] isApplicableProject failed
com.atlassian.servicedesk.api.BadRequestException: Error retrieving ProjectContext, project '12200' does not exist
{noformat}

h3. Suggested Solution
The suggestion would be to delete the automation rules during the JSD project deletion; JSDSERVER-6324.
 
h3. Workaround
The workaround consists in disabling directly in the database all the automation rules which are associated to projects which no longer exist. The steps are the following:
- Stop JIRA
- Backup the JIRA database
- Run the following query in the JIRA database
(!) Note that this query was tested on a PostgreSQL database and that it might need to be slightly changed depending on the database type
{code}
 update "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" set "ENABLED"='false' where "ID" in ( select r."ID" 
 from "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT" pc
 left join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" rr on pc."RULESET_REVISION_ID" = rr."ID"
 left join "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" r on rr."ID" = r."RULESET_REVISION_ID"
 left join "AO_9B2E3B_WHEN_HANDLER_CONFIG" whc on r."ID" = whc."RULE_ID"
 where pc."PROJECT_ID" not in (select id from project)); 
{code}
- Start JIRA
fields.summary: This is a regression bug of JSDSERVER-3232

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Whenever Service desk failed to set the issue property for {{request.public-activity.lastupdated}}, it will log the following:
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
2019-04-22 11:51:26,533 https-nio-8080-exec-1 ERROR username 711x199330x3 xxxxxx 10.0.0.1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.s.i.f.c.request.listener.RequestActivityIssueListener] Failed to get event initiating user to set issue property 'request.public-activity.lastupdated'
{code}

The above _only_ tells us that there is an error but no clear indication to which issue that is affected. We could only make out: username, action, timing.

From the code, it is noted that the ERROR was thrown due to Service desk unable to identify the user associated with the event triggered.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include the Issue key in the ERROR logging to help identify the affected issue which eventually could help in understanding the cause of the failure.

h3. Why this is important
Supportability. Improving logging to help identify the root cause.
 
h3. Notes
The issue property of {{request.public-activity.lastupdated}} is used for the purpose of sorting and limiting the searches for "Request" page in Customer Portal. If the value does not exist in the {{entity_property}} table for the respective issue, it will fall back to using the "Created date" value of the issue.

The issue/request will still be listed in the "Request" page in Customer portal with or without the 
 {{request.public-activity.lastupdated}} value for the respective issue.
fields.summary: Improve logging for failure of setting issue property

Currently, SLAs will start, pause, or stop whenever ANY conditions specified in the SLA configuration are met. As an admin, I would like to be able to start, pause, and stop SLAs when multiple conditions are met. 

For example, I want to pause an SLA timer when an agent has replied to an issue, but only if the issue is currently assigned to an agent.

h3. Suggested Solution

On the SLA setup screen, I can already select multiple conditions. Please allow me to also select whether "ANY" or "ALL" of the conditions selected must be met for each action to start, stop, or pause the SLA.
fields.summary: Start, Stop, or Pause SLA on multiple conditions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we try to add participants from the Customer Portal Jira, it does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the customer portal
# Open a request
# Try adding a participant to the request.

h3. Expected Results
A new participant is added to the request.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Notes:
* From the Development tools, a 500 error is thrown when adding, and a 400 error is thrown when removing, but the errors are generic and nothing is found in the application logs.
* It was found by [~hbarnett] that, when adding a participant, Service Desk is validating all custom fields, if there is an inconsistency with any of the custom fields, like having an invalid option or any issue at all, it is impossible to add request participants from the Customer Portal.

h3. Workaround
To fix any inconsistent custom field. Raise a support request to assist you in finding the inconsistency that is provoking the error.

fields.description:
*Background*
At the moment, the permission on who can raise requests to a SD project is controlled via the Customer Permissions options below:

Who can raise requests?
* Customers who are added to the project
* Customers who have an account on this Jira site
* Anyone can email the service desk or raise a request in the portal

We restrict the permission on who can raise a request by using the "Customers who are added to the project" option. 

However, we have a use case where we also want a particular group of users to be able to raise a request without the need for adding this user to the project.

*Suggestion*
We would like to have an option which grants a user the permission to raise requests and it overrides the permission in Customer Permission.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a customer's username contains a blank space, the password reset link replaces the blank space with a + character, causing a 400 error when resetting password.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a customer account with this username: *{{first last}}*
# As the customer, request a password reset
# From the password reset email sent by Service Desk, click _Reset my password_
# Try to reset password from the browser

h3. Expected behavior
Password can be reset normally.

h3. Actual behavior
Password can't be reset:
# From the GUI, it seems the page just refreshes itself without doing anything
# From the F12 developer tools, a 400 error is thrown with this message:
{code}
The reset password token you have provided has timed out.
{code}

h3. Workaround
Manually replace the + character in the password reset link with *%20* e.g.:
* Change the link from this:
{code}
<JIRA_URL>/servicedesk/customer/user/resetpassword?username=first+last&token=<Token>
{code}
to this then reset password normally:
{code}
<JIRA_URL>/servicedesk/customer/user/resetpassword?username=first%20last&token=<Token>
{code}
fields.summary: Customers whose username contains a blank space are not able to reset password

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Service Desk is changing the past approvers
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new ticket and set 3 different approvers
 !image-2019-04-15-16-10-01-395.png|width=982,height=435!
 # Decline the approval process with *one* user of the approvers set
 # Set the approval process to a new approver
 !image-2019-04-15-16-10-01-329.png|width=982,height=435!

h3. Expected Results

Jira Service Desk should keep the history of the past approval even if we change some approvers
h3. Actual Results

Jira Service Desk is updating the past approvals
h3. Workaround

You can workaround this problem by creating a new status (like "Approval round 2") and point this new status to a new custom field ("Approvers 2") that will be used for this second round of approval so by doing this we can make sure that we're not changing the past approvers and we'll keep the approval history correct.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a customer notification containing an attachment link is sent in plain text format, the attachment link has the incorrect format and can't be opened by the customer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new Service Desk request from the customer portal, by being logged in as customer1
# Add a different user (customer2) as a request participant of this request
# Temporarily give the user customer2 JIRA application access
# Log in as customer2 from the JIRA login page (not the customer portal login page)
# Edit the customer2 user profile to receive notifications in plain text format
# Log back in as customer1 and add an attachment to the request from the customer portal view (for example File.pdf)
# Check the customer notification received by customer2


h3. Expected Results

The attachment link in the customer notification should match the attachment link from the customer portal view, and from the customer notification in HTML format, which is:
http://localhost:8080/jira810/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10001/10001_File.pdf?fromIssue=10002


h3. Actual Results

The attachment link in the customer notification has the format of the attachment URL that only agents can view:
http://localhost:8080/jira810/secure/attachment/10001/10001_File.pdf

If the customer clicks on the attachment URL, they will get an error.

h3. Workaround

Change the customer2 user profile to receive notification in HTML format instead of plain text.
fields.summary: Incorrect attachment link in the customer notification sent in plain text format

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It would be great to have the following locations and capabilities for the JSW queue:

 !IT Service Desk Tester   Queues   Service Desk.png|thumbnail! 

This feature request includes 3 smaller requests which are correlated:

# A new location so that vendors can add new menu items for a SD queue. (See the attached screenshot.)
# A new location so that vendors can add new button for a SD queue. (Also see the shot.)
# A new Atlassian Connect context parameter which allows injecting the queue ID to the URLs that are generated for the web items in point 1 and 2. Vendor's example: if I look at the queue ID=1234, then I expect the URL's linked by my custom button or menu item to include this ID.

h3. Background
Vendor's working on the cloud version of PDF and Excel exporter apps. The server/DC version of these allow exporting issues from the queue screen, but in those version vendor can implement this with Javascript magic. This trick is not feasible in cloud, as their logic runs in a separate iframe, therefore they need the standard solution.

h3. Summary
Deleting a JIRA Service Desk project will not remove Automation rule data in the database.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The Automation rules still exist in the database:
* After project creation:
{noformat}
j802=# select * from "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK";
-[ RECORD 1 ]--------------+------------------------

-[ RECORD 2 ]-------+------
ID                  | 2

RULESET_REVISION_ID | 2
-[ RECORD 3 ]-------+------
ID                  | 3
PROJECT_ID          | 10000
RULESET_REVISION_ID | 3
-[ RECORD 4 ]-------+------
ID                  | 4

RULESET_REVISION_ID | 4

ID                  | 10

-[ RECORD 11 ]------+------
ID                  | 11
PROJECT_ID          | 10000
RULESET_REVISION_ID | 11
{noformat}
* After project deletion:
{noformat}
j802=# select * from "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK";
(No rows)
j802=# select * from "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT";
-[ RECORD 1 ]-------+------
ID                  | 1
PROJECT_ID          | 10000
RULESET_REVISION_ID | 1

RULESET_REVISION_ID | 10
-[ RECORD 11 ]------+------
ID                  | 11
PROJECT_ID          | 10000
RULESET_REVISION_ID | 11
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* When finding orphan automations, it seem that they are triggered by different events that might even be happening in other projects, and this causes an excessive logging (as all orphan automations will give one of these exceptions, having more than 50 will cause logs to be flodded pretty fast. The errors are like these: {code}2019-04-19 15:51:20,494 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-102 ERROR xxxx 951x38885x1 nr5e76 127.0.0.1 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.s.p.a.modules.rulewhen.ServiceDeskCommentCreatedEventWhenHandler] isApplicableProject failed
com.atlassian.servicedesk.api.BadRequestException: Error retrieving ProjectContext, project '17000' does not exist{code}

h3. Workaround
The workaround consists in disabling directly in the database all the automation rules which are associated to projects which no longer exist. 
(i) To identify orphan Automation rules, we can use this SQL:
{noformat}
select rpc."PROJECT_ID" as "rpc.PROJECT_ID", rr."ID" as "rr.ID", rr."NAME" as "Rule Set Name", rr."DESCRIPTION" as "Rule Set Description", rr."RULE_SET_ID" as "rr.RULE_SET_ID", rr."TRIGGER_FROM_OTHER_RULES", rs."ID" as "rs.ID", r."ID" as "r.ID", r."RULESET_REVISION_ID" as "r.RULESET_REVISION_ID", r."ENABLED"
from "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT" rpc 
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" rr on rr."ID" = rpc."RULESET_REVISION_ID"
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" r on r."RULESET_REVISION_ID" = rr."ID"
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET" rs on rs."ID" = rr."RULE_SET_ID"
where rpc."PROJECT_ID" not in (select id from project);
{noformat}
The steps to disable the orphan automations are the following:
- Stop JIRA
- Backup the JIRA database
- Run the following query in the JIRA database
(!) Note that this query was tested on a PostgreSQL database and that it might need to be slightly changed depending on the database type
{code}
 update "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" set "ENABLED"='false' where "ID" in ( select r."ID" 
 from "AO_9B2E3B_RSETREV_PROJ_CONTEXT" pc
 left join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" rr on pc."RULESET_REVISION_ID" = rr."ID"
 left join "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" r on rr."ID" = r."RULESET_REVISION_ID"
 left join "AO_9B2E3B_WHEN_HANDLER_CONFIG" whc on r."ID" = whc."RULE_ID"
 where pc."PROJECT_ID" not in (select id from project)); 
{code}
- Start JIRA

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using Firefox, in the Customer Portal, when making a transition, users are not able to CTRL + V URL Links into the Comment field of transitions. The issue tends to happen intermittently. After making some transitions, the same transition that was previously affected may not face the issue. After making more transitions, the same transition may face the issue again.

h3. Environment
Tested on Firefox 66.0.2 and 66.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make any transition via Customer Portal using Firefox
# Try to paste (via CTRL + V) in any URL Links in the Comment field
# The URL Link will not be pasted in (Note: Issue occurs intermittently)
** If the issue does not occur, try transitioning the ticket and try again

h3. Expected Results
URL Link gets pasted in the Comment field

h3. Actual Results
URL Link is not pasted in the Comment field. If you have highlighted a block of text, it will disappear as if being replaced but still no URL Link.

h3. Workaround
# Right-click and paste (from the dropdown menu)
# Press 'SHIFT' + 'INSERT' keys to paste
# Use other Web Browsers
fields.summary: Cannot CTRL + V URL links into Comment field of transition from the Customer Portal in Firefox

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, if a user wants to disable the Welcome emails sent to customers, there is an option at Project settings > Customer notifications to disable welcome emails, but it works in a way that is counter intuitive:
 !image-2019-04-11-17-39-16-565.png|thumbnail! 
The text for the switch indicates:
{quote}If enabled, account verification emails will not be sent to new customers. Customers won’t need to verify their email address or set up their account.{quote}

And the switch itself has a label on the right that always indicates "Do not send account verification emails", regardless of the status of the switch.

So, in summary, if the switch is OFF (grey color), emails are sent, if the switch is ON (green color) the emails are not sent, and _this can be confusing_.

The suggestion is the following: 
Change the title of the option from: {quote}Account verification email
If enabled, account verification emails will not be sent to new customers. Customers won’t need to verify their email address or set up their account.{quote} to {quote}Account verification email
If enabled, account verification emails will be sent to new customers and they will have to verify their email address/set up their account.{quote}
And "flip" the switch function so OFF means the email verification won't be sent, and ON for the email to be sent.
* Additionally, change the text next to the switch to reflect what is the current behavior according to the switch status:
** "Do not send account verification emails" when the switch is OFF
** "Send account verification emails" when the switch is ON.
fields.summary: The switch to disable the Welcome Email for customers is counter intuitive

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is not possible to sort the SLAs that has been created in a project. The way it listed is based when it is created so at some point the list can be all over the place.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will great if it is possible to list the SLAs created in the project whether it is based on Created or Alphabetically which can make it more organized.
fields.summary: Ability to sort the SLA list in the project

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Technology Consultant, I've been dealing with large amounts of issues import.

When importing CSV files, I''ve seen that I can't do a preview of what I'm about to import, to check if the import is successful or if it will have errors so, every time I find an error on import, I have to either edit the imported issue or fix it before importing the issue.

This could save a lot of time as, in some situations, it's just a small correction on the file to be imported rather than having to modify several created issues in Jira.
fields.summary: Add import preview before importing issues into Jira

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using [approvals|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-jira-service-desk-approvals-938847527.html] with Jira Service Desk, whenever an issue is approved, it will display the *Past approvals* section, with the status the issue *was* when the approval was done. This can be confusing for some users, as it might be interpreted as if the issue is still is pending approval.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to configure how *Past approvals* is displayed, to hide the statuses there if needed.
fields.summary: Allow users to hide the statuses from previous approvals

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the "Fire a Issue Created event that can be processed by the listeners" post function is modified to any other event in the 'Create Issue' transition from a Service Desk workflow, it will cause Jira to not set the customer channel properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Access the workflow from one of the issue types for that project and click on 'Edit'
# Click on the 'Create issue' transition, then on *Post functions*
# Click on the pencil icon for *Fire a Issue Created event that can be processed by the listeners* and modify it to any other event
# Publish the changes
# Create an issue using the modified workflow

h3. Expected Results

Jira will set up the request channel properly

h3. Actual Results

The issue will display *Channel: Unknown*

h3. Workaround

No known workaround other to ensure that the *Fire a Issue Created event that can be processed by the listeners* is set.
fields.summary: Jira won't set a channel properly without 'Issue Created' event

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA Service Desk, it is possible to delete a Request Type from a project. While it would not affect to the Customers where they can still access it and the comments are not missing, the only way to filter it in the "My Requests" page is to set it "Any Request Type" which will include other Request Type as well.


h3. Suggested Solution.
To add the filter option of "Unassigned Request Type" for any requests that do not have any Request Type or it has been deleted before. With this, it will filter these requests only without including any other request types.
fields.summary: "Unassigned Request Type" Filter in My Requests page for any Request Type that has been deleted.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When a user is added in both Watcher and Request participant field, and that user is mentioned in a comment (internal or public), the user received a Jira notification for it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk request
# Grant User A with the Browse Project permission to the project
# Add User A in the Request Participant and Watcher fields
# Get User B to mention User A in the comment field (internal comment)

h3. Expected Result
User A should not get the Jira notification as per the comment [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-2418?focusedCommentId=804174&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-804174], since user A should be treated as a customer.

h3. Actual Result
User A received Jira notification regarding the mention. 

h3. Note
If the comment is public, then user A will receive 2 notifications about the same comment:
- the Customer Notifications (configured in the Service Desk project in *Project Settings > Customer notifications* )
- the Jira @-mention notification
fields.summary: User gets "mention" notification when acting as both customer and collaborator at the same time

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It appears that using the feature "Create Linked Issue" from a ticket that has an organization to another Service Desk project will throw "Invalid organization ids specified" Error Message if the same organization does not exist in the target project.
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Have 2 Service Desk Project ready.
 # Create an Organization to SD Project A
 # In one of SD Project A, set the Organization to it.
 # After it, use the "More > Create Linked Issue" and select SD Project B as the target.
 # Click "Create"

h3. Expected Result:
 - The linked ticket will be created.

h3. Actual Result:
 - An error message "Invalid organization ids specified" will be thrown

h3. Workaround
 - Add the same Organization to SD Project B before creation.

h3. Note:
 - Tested in JIRA 7.6.0 and the error message will not appear with the linked issue is created.
 - This will happen when the target project is an SD Project

 

h3. Workaround
Remove the Organization field from the Issue creation screen on the project where the issue is being created.
fields.summary: Unable to create linked issue if the target project does not have the same Organization
